attributes.action: Give Retained Firefighters the right to leave employment to respond to 999 calls
attributes.background: Retained Firefighters make up a majority of the fire stations across Norfolk. Retained FireFighters drop their responsibilities the second their alerters alarm. Heading towards the fire station to respond to a 999 emergency.
attributes.additional_details:
I'm appealing for the rights of these firemen to be able to leave their employment to respond to life changing 999 calls . 

I aim to make it a law that employers have to allow retained Firefighters to leave their workplace to respond to these fire calls .

attributes.action: Make gcse exams free for all children under 18, including home educated children
attributes.background: Currently, parents/carers of home educated children must pay around £200 per GCSE subject that their child wishes to sit exams for (including exam board and exam centre fees). This actively discriminates against home educated children and should be funded by the government.
attributes.additional_details: Children and parents sometimes choose home education due to disabilities or vulnerability (for example, due to psychological issues caused by bullying brought about as a result of the main stream schooling system). As well as discriminating against home education, forcing parents/carers to pay for gcse exams out of their own pocket may result in gcse qualifications becoming less accessible to vulnerable children. This also risks certain disabled children starting life with fewer qualifications.

attributes.action: Make "Jerusalem" England's official national anthem by law
attributes.background: Two years ago, a bill passed the first reading backing the call to consider an official national anthem for the nation of England to be played for major UK and Commonwealth events. This petition builds on that bill, and humbly asks to make 'Jerusalem' the official national anthem of England.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-derbyshire-35296296, "MPs back calls for English national anthem". BBC News. London: BBC. 13 January 2016.

https://services.parliament.uk/bills/2015-16/englishnationalanthem.html, English National Anthem Bill 2015-16.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rT1HEXNI9c4, 'Jerusalem', the song in question.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to prevent farm animals from moving freely for long periods
attributes.background: Many farm animals are prevented from moving by tethering to stanchions in sheds, tie stalls and "zero grazing" systems for dairy cattle - and rarely or never letting them outside. Pigs are given no space to move in tiny "sow stalls" ; chickens by so many being in one shed they can barely move.
attributes.additional_details:
For information on zero grazing systems, tie stalls and tethering by the neck unable to move in dairy farming see this link
https://www.ciwf.org.uk/media/5235185/the-life-of-dairy-cows.pdf
On "sow stalls" for pigs leaving them unable to move at all
https://www.ciwf.org.uk/media/5235118/The-life-of-Pigs.pdf
Chickens farmed for meat
https://www.ciwf.org.uk/media/5235306/The-life-of-Broiler-chickens.pdf
Chickens farmed for eggs
https://www.ciwf.org.uk/media/5235024/The-life-of-laying-hens.pdf

attributes.action: Ban Plastic envelopes and Paper catalogues, where seller has e-mail details.
attributes.background: Having just received 5 "mail shots" in one postal delivery,from Internet retailers, they all went straight into recycling. Waste of plastic, paper, fuel and postage costs. All the Internet Retailers have my e-mail address and could just as easily have e-mailed their brochure saving all of the above.

attributes.action: To be allowed 500 words / 2 sides of notes to every GCSE exam.
attributes.background: As a GCSE student, me and other students feel it would be beneficial to let all students have at least 500 words or 2 sides of notes during a GCSE exam. As the exams should teach students knowledge on how to apply information and use it correctly and efficiently, and not to cram excess information.

attributes.action: Stop once and for all unsolicited SMS fraud in the UK
attributes.background: Shady companies are sending fraudulent unsolicited premium rate SMS text messages to mobile phone owners in the UK. These cost recipients up to £4.50 a message often resulting in huge bills to the victim as the fraud is likely to go unnoticed for long periods of time.
attributes.additional_details:
Find a detailed description of the issue here:

http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-3580058/Thousands-hit-4-50-time-scam-Customers-facing-bills-hundreds-pounds-texts-advertising-gaming-services-pornographic-content.html

This petition posits it should be a legal requirement for phone carriers to:

Not allow these services be activated on a customer’s account unless they have explicitly requested so (e.g. a representative of the carrier calls the customer to confirm activation of this service was indeed requested). If a carrier does not have this framework in place, they should not be allowed to operate premium SMS services at all.

attributes.action: Giving the British people the right to remove members of the Lords by petition.
attributes.background: I want to start this petition because some of the unelected members of the Lords are ignoring the will of the British people and acting in their own interests. There is no participation by the British people in who is appointed to the Lords. In a real democracy there should be a way to remove them .
attributes.additional_details: I help run a large Community Hall and a significant number of the membership when asked about the interference of the Lords into the EU referendum cannot understand why they are not answerable to anyone.

attributes.action: Require all products sold in the UK containing plastic to have a warning label.
attributes.background: Plastic pollution is an ever growing global and local problem. It's important that consumers realise what they are buying, products/packaging containing plastic should bare a warning label to enable consumers to make better choices and to encourage producers to look for better alternatives.

attributes.action: Remove the no smoking ban from mental health hospitals
attributes.background: I recently stayed in a mental health hospital and was unable to smoke. This is almost a form of torture. For 5 days i was unable to go out or go to a smoking area. People have enough stress while in hospital, there should be a smoking area where people can go to at least once an hour

attributes.action: Scrap school league tables to reduce pressures on young people and teachers
attributes.background: At the root cause of mental health difficulties in young people are league tables. There is pressure on students and staff to succeed as they are judged on exam performance data. Students with special educational needs flounder or move from mainstream schools which are struggling to be inclusive.
attributes.additional_details:
The government recognises the need to transform the mental health provision for children and young people (Green paper, Dec 2017). Whilst the proposals are welcomed, it would make sense to address the underlying causes. 
The Guardian stated that exclusions are increasing partly because schools are under pressure to compete in league tables and exam results. Disruptive,vulnerable pupils who are likely to lower overall GCSE performance are weeded out before their national tests (Oct 2017).

attributes.action: On four lane motorways, restrict HGV vehicles and coaches to lanes 1 and 2.
attributes.background: The country has spent billions in upgrading traditional motorways to four lane smart motorways, however all this investment is wasted as soon as you get three trucks trying to overtake each other at 55mph. Trucks should be limited to lanes 1 and 2 to allow faster travellers to go in lanes 3 and 4.

attributes.action: Use the money needed to change the passport colour for the NHS and the homeless
attributes.background: The Prime Minister has just announced that after Brexit our passports will change colour. This seems completely unnecessary and the money and resources needed could be put to better use like helping our underfunded NHS and helping homeless people off the streets.

attributes.action: Allow Petitions Calling for No Confidence in Ministers on petition.parliament.uk
attributes.background: Call government/parliament to allow petitions calling for a vote of No Confidence in Ministers/MPs due to the recent decision by the petitions committee not to accept/allow them. The decision should be made by the British public who politicians, parliament & the petitions committee are answerable to
attributes.additional_details: We live in a democratic country where the general public must have a voice that can be heard and taken into account.  Ministers and MPs must be accountable to the general public who should have the right to submit a petition for debate which people across the U.K. can support.  Some previous petitions calling for No Confidence have had over 100,000 signatures however only a few people in the petitions committee have decided not to allow them in the future

attributes.action: Impose checks on companies reporting gender pay gap figures
attributes.background: The Financial Times recently reported that some companies who have submitted data on the gender pay gap within their organisations have produced ‘highly improbable’ figures. The government must set up a task force to investigate them and impose fines on companies who have filed inaccurate data.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.ft.com/content/ad74ba76-d9cb-11e7-a039-c64b1c09b482

15 organisations so far have declared that they have no pay gap. The FT reported that it was 'highly anomalous' for those companies to report no gap. Since the FT scrutinised the figures of Hugo Boss, who initially reported zero pay gap, they have amended their submission to a mean gender pay gap of 32.6%. The law was introduced to prevent organisations from hiding their gender pay gaps. Let’s not allow them to  report false data.

attributes.action: Make local councils install CCTV outside schools to reduce the risk of accidents
attributes.background:
We all see lazy parents dropping their children off at school. 

This petition is to ask the government to make it compulsory for local councils to install cctv outside schools to catch and fine drivers who ignore road safety. In an attempt to persuade lazy drivers not to park on zig zag markings.

attributes.action: Campaign for a Festival of Britain 2021 to celebrate 70 years since last one
attributes.background: UK has faced years of austerity - likely to continue up to 2021. This would give the British people a feel-good factor and added  prestige throughout the world, which will promote tourism.  An opportunity for trade and industry visits from other nations to showcase the UK as open for business
attributes.additional_details: Refer to the previous Festival of Britain in 1951 and look at what events occurred from those days and consider an updated version which included London and other provincial cities.   Put into place exhibitions, the provision of a festival ship (which occurred previously to promote British ports and industry).  Ask other major cities to put on events that may be a speciality to that particular region (eg historical interests and future innovations).

attributes.action: Require online retailers and platforms to disclose courier before order placed
attributes.background: When ordering goods online, websites generally do not state which courier service they will use for delivery. However, several courier companies have a track record of poor customer service and losing/damaging parcels. If consumers know which courier will be used, they can choose not to order.
attributes.additional_details: For an example, view the "tweets and replies" at @myhermes

attributes.action: Continue the "Retained right of residence" for former Spouse of  EEA nationals
attributes.background:
Under Current EEA regulations, former spouses of EEA nationals, retain their right to reside in the UK, even after they cease to be family members of an EEA national.
.
attributes.additional_details: This is a vital protection, as this covers former spouses who have been the victims of domestic voilence and other vulnerable people. Furthermore, people who retain their right of residence, are living in the UK by the virtue of EEA law, and so it is only fair that these people are also covered by the brexit negotiations and the protections afforded to EEA nationals are also extended to those people who retain their right of residence

attributes.action: reduce the brightness of vehicle emergency blue lights by half at night.
attributes.background: As a driver who works nights , I am regularly blinded by emergency vehicles using blue flashing lights. This causes a severe risk to other road users as my vehicle is a hgv that would cause mayhem if I lost control due to being blinded by these lights.

attributes.action: Relocate UK parliament and government departments somewhere outside London.
attributes.background:
The Palace of Westminster is in poor condition, requiring £4B of refurbishment work, at state expense. It's, also, regularly argued that government is too London-centric.
It's time to relocate government to a new common site, outside London, and use Westminster Palace as a commercial asset.
attributes.additional_details:
Today, Westminster Palace is a far from suitable place from where to run government and, overall, London is over-crowded, costly and detached from much of the country. Considering these points, I propose constructing a modern government campus, in a more central location, with good London transport links, perhaps, somewhere around where the M1 and west-coast main lines converge, in Northamptonshire.
The campus should include a station and accommodation for MPs staying away from home.

attributes.action: Introduce a 'no-fly' list banning disruptive & dangerous passengers from flying.
attributes.background: Presently several politicians claim the lack of alcohol-licensing at airports is to blame for an increase in air rage incidents.  Therefore several are pushing to restrict in-flight alcohol-sales at airports and in-flight, which would punish the majority.
attributes.additional_details: Instead of punishing the majority of decent passengers, a 'no-fly' list, similar to the one the Americans have, would be fairer on the majority of passengers and more effective in preventing alcohol-related problems like air rage.  Also the prospect of being given a lengthy or indefinite ban from flying would likely provide a much greater disincentive to avoid breaking the law during flights.

attributes.action: Require hoists and proper facilities to be installed in all disabled toilets
attributes.background: Whilst out I needed cleaning and changing. My nephew had to physically lift me out of my wheelchair and hold on to me to clean and change me. It was difficult and I could easily have had a fall and he could have hurt himself. All disabled toilets need a hoist and proper changing facilities.

attributes.action: Call on Boris Johnson to apologise immediately to Libya
attributes.background: Boris Johnson, the UK’s foreign secretary, is yet again finding himself in troubled water after making arguably racist remarks about another country. The fact that a foreign secretary can do this is baffling. He must apologise immediately - his views are NOT echoed by the UK people.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.google.co.uk/amp/s/www.bbc.com/news/amp/uk-politics-41490174

attributes.action: Be illegal to drive tractors on A roads between the hours of 8am to 7pm
attributes.background: Tractors and other slow moving farm vehicles are a menice to other road users due to them causing large tailbacks which make people take risks to over take.

attributes.action: Commemorate the life of Stephen Hawking with a day of national mourning.
attributes.background:
One of the greatest minds of his generation.
A national treasure.
Influential for years to come.

attributes.action: Update the Fatal Accidents Act 1976 to help bereaved families.
attributes.background: The loss of a loved one following a fatal injury (accident or murder) drastically needs updating. We need to expand the number of family members who are entitled to a bereavement award and to increase the compensation which currently stands at £12,980. The  Law tells us who is entitled to claim.
attributes.additional_details:
Why does it need updating...? 

A wife can claim £12,980 for loss of her husband but nothing if she loses an adult child. If a child loses a parent, the child receives nothing. 

However celebrities can obtain over £200,000 for breach of privacy for phone hacking.

A person killed instantly in an accident or murdered is worth NOTHING.  

The cost of looking after a DOG is more than a bereavement award and more than life itself.

Please help bereaved families and children who have lost parents.

attributes.action: Bring back the death penalty in the UK
attributes.background: Is it fair and just that someone who takes a life and is of sound body and mind is allowed to carry on living albeit incarcerated in one of HM prisons, and in due time being released by nature of serving their sentence or early parole .
attributes.additional_details: If the death Penalty was to be reintroduced in the UK. it would surely bring down knife and gun crime and make people think twice before committing premeditated or random attacks on innocent members of the public

attributes.action: Make 11/11/2018 a non-trading day in remembrance of the First World War
attributes.background: There have been global commemorations to acknowledge the debt owed by all of us to all those affected by the terrible events of World War One. The Centenary of the ending of WW1 falls on Sunday 11/11/18. there can be a no better way to show our respect by ceasing all trading on that day.

attributes.action: Impose sanctions on America until they change their laws regarding firearms
attributes.background: Since the start of 2018, 18 school shootings have occurred in the USA - averaging to three every week. This is as much a gun control issue as it is a mental health issue. We call upon the government to impose some sanctions upon the US until they DO something to control this devastating situation.

attributes.action: Ban the sale of Angora rabbit fur products in the UK
attributes.background: Angora rabbit fur is often harvested from live rabbits. Their legs are stretched and pinned down while their fur is ripped out leaving them to scream helplessly in pain. Its an inhumane and cruel practice that we must make a stand against.
attributes.additional_details: Britain should make a stand against and the Angora fur trade to demonstrate cruelly harvested products are not tolerated. The unethical practice of removal of rabbit fur in China has recently been highlighted by People for the Unethical Treatment of Animals (PETA.) Their graphic evidence is featured on their website. The rabbits are kept in disgusting conditions and subjected to abuse that is beyond words.

attributes.action: Take in our fair share of refugees from the Mediterranean crisis
attributes.background: The crisis in the Mediterranean has seen a shocking display of reluctance to take action in order to help those fleeing war and disaster. Countries such as Italy have been left alone to disproportionately host refugees and asylum seekers. It's government's moral duty to host our fair share.
attributes.additional_details: In July 2017, Italy pleaded for the help of other European nations to deal with the record influx of refugees it was experiencing. In 2016, Italy took in a total of 181,436 people (TIME magazine). In 2016 the UK received 38,500 asylum applications, only 45% of these were granted (British Red Cross). The number of applications were considerably less than that of Germany (587,346) and Sweden (83,103).

attributes.action: Make funeral wishes legally binding documents.
attributes.background: Having worked in the care sector for a number of years I have been amazed to discover that a persons funeral wishes that they specified are not legally binding.
attributes.additional_details: Having worked in the care sector for a number of years I have been amazed to discover that a persons funeral wishes that they specified are not legally binding. It's ultimately it is for your executors or administrators (where there are no executors) to decide upon how your body is disposed of and your funeral conducted. This is not acceptable. Surely a person who leaves an estate has the right to choose how their funeral is conducted and how their body is disposed of.

attributes.action: Stop Reducing our Armed Forces and Spend 3% of GDP. CUT AID to 0.3% to fund it.
attributes.background: When I say "reduce" I mean in three ways: Funding, manpower & resources and credibility. We're told the Government spends 2% of GDP on defence and we have "the second largest budget in NATO... Largest in Europe". Then why can't we even match the French in capability anymore? Spend 3% GDP on Defence.
attributes.additional_details: France has 23 Destroyers and Frigates. We've 19. They've 3 Amphibious ships. We've 2 which are now going to be scrapped. Their Army is 30,000 bigger. You now want to cut another 14,000 and are talking about merging two extremely distinct units: Royal Marines and Parachute Regiment. It's a joke. You don't want the Army to "Be the Best" and the new adverts are laughable. Recruits join for war fighting, adventure and service. Not for PC. That 2% clearly feels like 1% and those in charge are inept.

attributes.action: Government to pay for all car repairs caused by potholes
attributes.background: We all pay car tax and council tax and yet our roads are left in unsafe and damaged conditions many of witch need ripping up and relaying completely which can cause serious damage to our cars. Having paid the tax, we should not have to pay for any damage to wheels, suspension, track rods, cv joints.
attributes.additional_details: These roads are being reported yet only a temporary fix or not at all until such time the roads are safe to drive on with out the risk of damage the local council or government should pick up the bills.

attributes.action: Make the purchase and use of pepper spray and/or stun devices legal.
attributes.background: It is almost illegal to defend yourself in the UK. I think it is about time; especially considering current situation, that it changes. It should be legal to carry an item for the purpose of defence and the above items should be legalised, even if licensing is required.

attributes.action: Make the vehicle log book(V5C) proof of ownership
attributes.background: A motor vehicle is usually of high value, easily identified and in the public eye. It is also generally bought and sold several times throughout its lifetime.The UK does not, surprisingly have any 'Ownership Title' document, which is a bit weird when you think about it.
attributes.additional_details:
The DVLA, Government, Police, Finance Companies etc., all have their own reasons and all of them can explain the current form of V5C but it does not help and it does not matter.
 What matters and is very important is your opinion. You, the reader, can change something for the better. Here, now! Think about you and others. Make it simple, easy and clear. Protect yourself against problems! Protect yourself from crooks and criminals, scammers and thieves! 
 If you want an ownership title for your vehicle/motor then please, please sign this petition! Make your opinion count! Make the V5C proof of ownership!
Thank you

attributes.action: Grant my sick mum indefinite leave to remain
attributes.background: On 24/11/2017 my mum was detained at a IR centre and hastily removed from the UK giving us little time to prepare given her age. The NRC just sent her back without proper consultation or duty of care as to how she would be cared for once she is there, since her immediate family is here in the UK.
attributes.additional_details: My father was a political refugee following the 1980 elections in Jamaica, it was hard for mum as a single mother with little education. I migrated to the UK in 1997 to join my wife who was having our first child. My mum traveled back and forth to the UK for visits. When we were about to have our 3rd child in 2002, we decided that it was best for her to stay and that was the start of our struggles with the Home Office to get them to grant her indefinite leave to remain.

attributes.action: Allow all UK citizens to choose the colour of their own passport.
attributes.background: This petition would permit each individual citizen to choose their own passport colour, which should be possible regardless of the eventual outcome of Brexit. Contrary to popular opinion, the EU does NOT mandate the passport colour of its member states.

attributes.action: Highlights of all Test Matches (cricket) involving the Home Nations free to air
attributes.background: Currently only England home test match highlights have to be free to air, which means that the achievements of our cricketers whilst abroad cannot to seen by the majority of fans.
attributes.additional_details:
The actual changed needed it to add all Test Matches (cricket) involving the Home Nations to Category B in the Ofcom Code on Sports and Other Listed and Designated Events.

Sport England’s latest active people survey shows that over the past decade (since, coincidence or not, cricket was last on free-to-air TV) the number of people aged over 16 who play it at least once a week has dropped from 195,200 to 158,500 and the number who play at least once a month has dropped from 380,300 to 278,600.

attributes.action: Introduce legislation to protect students from universities and letting agencies
attributes.background: Started by a student who has had exposure to injustice in regards to university, letting agencies and landlords. University is stressful as it is, let alone overpaying for a property that isn't fit for purpose. I want to make life bearable for students who want to better themselves.
attributes.additional_details:
It should be illegal for:

- Letting agencies and landlords to let below par properties for high rent.

- Universities who knowingly deliver below par education and still charge high fees.

- Letting agencies and landlords to overcharge student deposits.

One in four students suffer with mental health problems. Students are currently vulnerable and have no protection from the government against these flaws.  Students need to be taken seriously and be seen as the future of this country.

attributes.action: Request that any Brexit bill be itemised and debated in parliament and public.
attributes.background:
Since the vote to leave the EU there have been multiple figures given in the press over any divorce bill varying between 20 - 100 billion pounds. 
We the undersigned demand that prior to any exit agreement the divorce bill should be itemised and made available for parliamentary and public scrutiny.
attributes.additional_details: Daily updates in the national and world press regarding the so called Brexit " divorce bill".

attributes.action: Stop the UK goverment from giving more than £20 billion to the EU.
attributes.background: Looking at net figures Britain has consistently paid billions of pounds to the EU usually only Germany contributing more. We have given so much over the years to help other EU members but with public services now struggling to meet the demands put on them it is time to put our own people first.

attributes.action: Make all cyclists use cycle paths where provided rather than using roads.
attributes.background:
Why as a cyclist would we want to not use an area dedicated to us for our safety, and irritate motor vehicle drivers by not using what has cost thousands of pounds to provide.
If we use these dedicated cycle ways we will reduce the amount of accidents and injuries to fellow cyclists.

attributes.action: Abolish taxation on voluntary tips for good service.
attributes.background: A tip is a voluntary gift from a person being served to a server and as such should be given tax exempt status. As many people who rely on tips are students, in between jobs or in low income families this would help ease ever increasing money burdens and possibly even stimulate the economy.

attributes.action: To have a public holiday on 21 October to be called Trafalgar Day.
attributes.background: To commemorate one of the greatest days in our history.  We should be proud of that victory in 1805.  It is long overdue.

attributes.action: Ban farm machinery using the A55 during peak commuting hours
attributes.background: Slow-moving farm machinery is often causing delays during peak times for commuters. This has also often led to accidents causing lane/road closures and further/longer delays, as well as a drain on resources and a increased carbon emissions.

attributes.action: Form a cross-party commission (national consensus) which negotiates Brexit
attributes.background:
I  think that the issue is too important, so we have to get it right. Such a Independent cross-party, all encapsulating approach will be formidable.
1. It will represent all of us 
2. it will show at the negotiations that; we mean Business! 
3. The whole nation will be behind it
attributes.additional_details:
When we and future generations look back at these historic times we can then at least know for sure that everyone took part and was represented in this monumental decision and effort of exiting the EU. And did it as seamlessly as possible.    

If we do not negotiate with national consensus the chances of us and the future generations resenting the actions that were taken will be inevitable.

eg. the IRAQ WAR and the Chilcott report

attributes.action: Every person in the UK to be given a tree to plant to reverse UK deforestation
attributes.background: The UK is believed to be in deforestation (cut down more trees than are planted). This is on top of the UK tree land mass (13%) is far behind other countries, EU (38%), Japan (68%), USA (34%). If every person in the UK were given a tree to plant the UK tree population could dramatically increase

attributes.action: Create a new public holiday for Indian new year's day
attributes.background: Show the British people that Government policies are truly representative of the the cultural diversity across our society. Diwali and Indian New Year mark an important time of the year for many different groups and we should mark this occasion with a public holiday.
